intro: Foetidia mauritiana var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated foetidia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals, and appear in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
